sourcing.instructions: Hg: Obtain from a chemical supply store or online chemical supplier. Nd: Purchase from a rare earth metals supplier. Ru: Acquire from a precious metals dealer or supplier.
steps: Hg: Obtain from a chemical supply store or online chemical supplier. Nd: Purchase from a rare earth metals supplier. Ru: Acquire from a precious metals dealer or supplier.

1. Measure 100 g of Hg into a glass container. 2. Measure 300 g of Nd into a separate container. 3. Measure 160 g of Ru into another container. 4. Combine the contents of all three containers in a fume hood or well-ventilated area while wearing appropriate PPE. 5. Stir the mixture thoroughly to ensure homogeneity. 6. Transfer the mixture to a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 100 g of Hg into a glass container. 2. Measure 300 g of Nd into a separate container. 3. Measure 160 g of Ru into another container. 4. Combine the contents of all three containers in a fume hood or well-ventilated area while wearing appropriate PPE. 5. Stir the mixture thoroughly to ensure homogeneity. 6. Transfer the mixture to a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 900°C. 2. Place the crucible with the mixed materials into the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 900°C. 2. Place the crucible with the mixed materials into the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying.

steps: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the furnace to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 3. Do not open the furnace until it has reached room temperature to avoid thermal shock to the alloy.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the furnace to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 3. Do not open the furnace until it has reached room temperature to avoid thermal shock to the alloy.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Allow the alloy to cool in a safe area for an additional hour. 3. Remove any oxidation or impurities from the surface using fine-grit sandpaper. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating suitable for metal to prevent corrosion. 5. Cut the alloy to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches if necessary.
